About 34 years ago, Lt. Colonel Petrov was in charge of early warning monitoring systems that showed a single US missile launch heading for the CCCP.

Procedure would have been to immediately report it up the chain of command, but his judgement told him that the US would not launch a lone missile, and he reported that their own systems had malfunctioned. It turned out the EWS had miss-identified reflections from clouds as a launch.

Thanks for saving the world, Mr. Petrov.

I remember reading about this!!!

Very, very wise man for seeing the truth!

RIP, sir!!!

This man deserved alot more fame, he litterly saved our world.

RIP
The closest we've ever had so far to someone who literally saved the world. Truly a respectable and admirable individual.

He has actually saved the world.

Rest in Peace, good sir.

Of course, many people can be said to have saved the world. We should honor them all.
